title: WHAT IS A ADC
body:
Ok, u might think this is nooby BUT WHAT IS A ADC. AND WHAT DO THEY DO????? WHAT DOES IT STAND FOR? WHICH ONE SHOULD I BUY???
D:

replies.body:
stands for Attack Damage Carry.

Someone that does physical damage, and is usually really good and carrying games.
Examples are:

Ashe- Has slows for days, great at kiting. NO ESCAPE- CC ult.

Caitlyn- Great at long range poke, small form of CC. Burst ULT. (What I mean by poke, can spam abilities, autos to deal great dmg.)

Corki- Has an escape, medium range. Great at poking.

Draven- NO ESCAPE, small form of CC. Execution ULT.

Ezreal- Has an escape, Great poke, medium range. Global (Line skil shot) Burst ULT.

Graves- Somewhat tanky, HAS A RELOAD MECHANIC, great Burst - small poke.

Jhin- Small poke/Burst. Small form of CC. NO ESCAPE, BURST/POKE ULT.

Jinx- Great poke, small form of CC. NO ESCAPE. GLOBAL BURST EXECUTION ULT.

Kalistar- Sudden burst DMG, small form of escape, ULT CAN ONLY BE USED WITH ANOTHER PLAYER. ULT AoE CC (Its an area of effect knock up)

Kindred- has small burst, a slow, small form of escape, Invul ult. (While players are in the circle friend or foe, they cannot die, circle heals all in it afterwards.)

Kog-Maw- Great Burst, poke. NO ESCAPE. Best poke ULT in the game.

Lucian- Has an escape, great burst/poke.

Miss Fortune- small form of CC, great burst, HAS NO ESCAPE, AoE burst ULT. 

Quinn- Forms of CC, has burst. Small form of escape. AoE Burst ULT.

Sivir- Has a shield to block SPELLS and gain mana, Great poke, AoE movespeed ULT.

Twitch- Can go invisible. Can poke, can have burst. ULT LONG RANGE auto attacks.

Urgot- NO ESCAPE, small form of poke. can reduce armor, Displacement ULT. (You swap positions with enemy target.)

Varus- Great poke, great Burst, NO ESCAPE. AoE CC ULT (If you hit)

Vayne- Small form of escape, can go invisible. Sudden burst every 3 attacks on the same target. SMALLEST ATTACK RANGE out of all ADC's. Can shred tanks.

------------------------

Ezreal and Ashe are the easiest to learn.
Try those first.

ADC is a synonym for the Attack Damage Carrier. As the current meta goes, the ADC goes duo bottom lane with a support champ. The role of the ADC is to be the main damage dealer in team fights. Commonly these champs are ranked attackers (Ashe, Vayne, Tristana, Draven etc) and kite a lot to deal damage from afar, which means mainly staying in the back line out of harms way to deal the damage.
They sacrifice general tankyness in order to deal more damage.

As far as buying one goes, there should always be atleast 1 available in free to play, try as many out as you can before buying one. But if you want to dive right in, Ashe is a good champ to learn with. A good kit, easy to use.

>ADC is an abbreviation for Attack Damage Carry. Currently, the ADC goes into a duo with a partner in the bottom lane, the partner usually goes a support champion. The role of ADC is to be the main source of physical damage in a team fight. Commonly these champions attack from a range, generally, the average range of an ADC is 550, although, sometimes this differs, champions such as Ashe, Vayne, Tristana, Caitlyn, Draven, etc. have ranges spanning between 500 and 650. Thought, these champions are easily killed, so they usually kite (run away while attacking) to deal damage without dying. But the easiest way is staying in the back line out of harms way to deal the damage. They usually sacrifice general tank stats in exchange for more damage.
